bibl.title: The High Priest of Alexandria and All Egypt.
bibl.note: The creation of the post of High Priest of Alexandria and All Egypt marks an important phase in the subjection of Temple to State. From the mid-second cent. A.D. the activities of the clergy were subject to the jurisdiction of this one man who, despite his title, was a bureaucrat.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the Sixteenth International Congress of Papyrology

bibl.seg: Stead Miriam, The High Priest of Alexandria and All Egypt.
Proceedings of the Sixteenth International Congress of Papyrology (Chico, 1981) pp. 411-418.

The creation of the post of High Priest of Alexandria and All Egypt marks an important phase in the subjection of Temple to State. From the mid-second cent. A.D. the activities of the clergy were subject to the jurisdiction of this one man who, despite his title, was a bureaucrat.
